definition[0]: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc
example[0]: the leaders who govern the country
example[1]: The party had been governing for seven months.
definition[1]: if rules, principles etc govern the way a system or situation works, they control how it happens
example[2]: legislation governing the export of live animals
example[3]: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
definition[2]: to officially and legally run a country and make decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc
example[4]: the politicians who govern the country
example[5]: A small military elite has been governing for just seven months.
definition[3]: if rules, principles etc govern the way a system or organization works, they control how things are done
example[6]: Law Society members are highly qualified and governed by a strict code of ethics.
example[7]: The current system governing credit card transactions in the UK goes against basic trading practices.
